L7p:Comment.stringValue: This API accepts dynamic oauth client registrations as defined in the context of OpenID Connect Dynamic Registration
=== *** THIS POLICY IS OVERWRITTEN DURING AN UPGRADE ***
=== Be aware that custom configuration made in this policy is overwritten during a solution kit upgrade.
=== However, the older version of the policy is kept in the history and can be referenced.
=== After upgrade, manually merge customizations from the old version of the policy to the new version.

L7p:value.stringValue: // This is here in case the gateway has both MAG and OTK installed, because MAG also has error code 111 and that results in different error.msg
// error code produced in previous assertion
Check if the session_output is JSON

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Incoming message contains characters that we do not accept: <,>,& and \" are not allowed.

L7p:value.stringValue: // validate that incoming message is JSON

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Using default application_type 'web' since none or an invalid one was provided

L7p:value.stringValue: // application_type MAY be provided, default: web
// FAPI advanced does not support public clients
// surround the comma separated list with double quotes
// surround each comma with double quotes (")
// https scheme only allowed with hostname localhost
// http scheme only allowed with hostname localhost
// handling differently for FAPI public clients
// accept only https, do not accept localhost or fragments, generally for all application types

L7p:Detail.stringValue: No or invalid redirect_uri(s) were provided: '${redirect_uris}'

L7p:value.stringValue: // needs to point to a URL and must be customizable
remove double quotes and any whitespace characters
remove double quotes and any whitespace characters
// Misuse this assertion to compare space separated lists of values

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Invalid sector_identifier_uri(s) or invalid redirect_uri(s): '${sector_identifier_uri}'

L7p:value.stringValue: // Check if sector_identifier_uri contains all redirect_uris
// use the first _redirect_uri. Its the best we have to make the registration unique
// extract the first redirect_uri used as default values for 'client_name', 'organization'

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Using default response_type 'code' since none were provided

L7p:value.stringValue: // response_type(s) MAY be provided, default: code

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Using default grant_type 'authorization_code' since none or invalid ones were provided

L7p:value.stringValue: // grant_type(s) MAY be provided, default: authorization_code
// used further down when persisting data
// default to empty if client does not provide jwks
// client provides jwks in registration request
// if jwks is not given, no need to validate
Check if the jwks is JSON object
// if jwks is given, check if it is a json object

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Incoming message contains characters that we do not accept: <,>,& and \" are not allowed.

L7p:value.stringValue: // validate that incoming jwks is JSON
// default to empty if client does not provide jwks_uri
// client provides jwks_uri in registration request
// neither jwks nor jwks will be used to replace the secret
// both jwks and jwks_uri are empty
// jwks is given, but no jwks_uri
// jwks_uri is given, but no jwks

L7p:Comment.stringValue: if both jwks and jwks_uri are given, return an error

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Error: Both jwks and jwksuri were provided.

L7p:value.stringValue: // The jwks_uri and jwks parameters MUST NOT be used together
// determine if jwks or jwks_uri will be used

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Invalid request_uri(s) were provided: '${request_uris}
Invalid request_object_signing_alg were provided: '${request_object_signing_alg}
Invalid request_object_encryption_alg were provided: '${request_object_encryption_alg}
Invalid request_object_encryption_enc were provided: '${request_object_encryption_enc}
Incompatable token endpoint auth method - 'token_endpoint_auth_method'
jwks/jwk_uri should not be empty when using "private_key_jwt" or "self_signed_tls_client_auth" auth method.

L7p:value.stringValue: // check jwks/jwks_uri is not empty if method is "private_key_jwt"
// a token_endpoint_auth_method MAY be given. No support: none

L7p:Comment.stringValue: Validate jwks or pki for mTLS authentication
end of mTLS authentication metadata validation

L7p:value.stringValue: // any of the supported alg can be used
// use the first _redirect_uri. Its the best we have to make the registration unique

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Invalid authorization signed response algorithm provided: '${authorization_signed_response_alg}
Invalid authorization encryted response algorithm provided: '${authorization_encrypted_response_alg}
'authorization_encrypted_response_alg' must be provided for authorization_encrypted_response_enc: '${authorization_encrypted_response_enc.result}
Invalid authorization signed response algorithm were provided: '${authorization_encrypted_response_enc}

L7p:value.stringValue: // use jws or jwks_uri as client's secret if either jwks or jws_uri is given during OIDC registration.
// use pki param for client authentication
// by default, registration will generate a secret, convert plain text secret to hashed if it is not marked as master key and CWP 'otk.hashed_secret.enable' set as 'true'
// by default, registration will generate a secret
